{{also|dịch}} ==English== ===Noun=== {{en-noun|es}} # {{obsolete form of|en|ditch||a trench}} ===Verb=== {{en-verb|diches|diching|diched}} # {{obsolete form of|en|ditch||to dig a trench}} {{Webster 1913}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=cdhi|chid}} ---- ==Cimbrian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|gmh|dich}}, from {{inh|gsw|goh|dih||thee}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|dich}}. ===Pronoun=== {{head|cim|pronoun form}} # {{lb|cim|7}} {{infl of|cim|du||acc}}: [[you]], [[thee]] ===See also=== {{cim-decl-personal pronouns}} ===References=== * {{R:Martalar1974}} ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Dich}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|dih}}, akin to {{cog|osx|thī}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-dich.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/dɪç/}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun forms}} # {{lb|de|personal}} {{inflection of|de|du||acc}}, [[you]], [[thee]] (''direct object''). #: ''Ich liebe '''dich''' nicht, wenn du mich nicht liebst.'' #:: I don't love you if you don't love me. # {{lb|de|reflexive pronoun}} accusative; [[yourself]], [[thee]] (''direct object''). {{rfc|de|templatize}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} {{cln|de|personal pronouns|reflexive pronouns}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|dih}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*þek}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/tiç/}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|hrx|pronoun}} # stressed and unstressed [[accusative]] of [[du]]: [[you]] (''direct object''), [[thee]]. #: {{ux|hrx|Ich sihn '''dich''' dart.|I see '''you''' there.}} ====Inflection==== {{hrx-decl-personal pronouns}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Old Irish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sga|/dʲix/}} ===Verb=== {{head|sga|verb form|head=·dich}} # {{infl of|sga|téit||3|s|perfective|pres|subj|prototonic}} # {{infl of|sga|do·fich||3|s|pres|indc|prototonic}} ===Mutation=== {{sga-mutation|d|ich|p=·}}
